unnormalised: Someone asked me, "Is it good to invest Rs. 5000 in the stock market right now?" Well, bhai, it depends! Are you looking for quick returns or thinking long-term? If you're expecting to double your money by next week, maybe stocks aren't the best place. Also, consider where you are investing: direct stocks, MF (Mutual Funds), ETFs etc. Each has its own level of risk and reward.

unnormalised: See, the market can be pretty volatile, especially with all the global news affecting things. One day Sensex is up 300 points, the next day it's down 400! But if you're in it for the long haul, like 5-10 years, and investing in good companies or diversified mutual funds, that Rs. 5000 can grow quite nicely. Think of it like planting a tree - you gotta give it time to grow, right? Just don't put all your eggs in one basket!
